I`m Melanie, a quantitative ecologist currently working at the [Natural History Museum in Berlin](https://www.naturkundemuseum.berlin/en/einblicke/mitarbeiter/melanie.tietje), Germany. My work includes extinction risk influencing factors, geographic range size patterns, and recently the combination of climatic and biological data. I am interested in the possibilities of combining neontological and paleontological data to learn from past events about our possible future. 

In November 2019 I will start a Postdoc at [Aarhus University](https://pure.au.dk/portal/en/persons/melanie-tietje(6abaa223-a82b-4577-acce-f2ead58ba86b).html) in the TropiToL project (Explaining the biological hyperdiversity of Tropical rainforests using the Tree of Life).
